For instance-you start talking electronics, and to me your are speaking a f=
oreign language.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: April Abercrombie=
 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, April 21, 2009 8:21 AM
  =
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR






  LOL!! It all right Frank. It's=
 the little things that escape us. Besides, your forte lies in other areas =
:)


    ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: Frank Sumption 
    To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Tuesday, April 21, 2009 8:16 AM
    Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR



     I am always so suprised at my lack o=
f brain/intellect/perception! I had an old Radio Shack digital voice record=
er--it does the que and review, and so does the new one. Huge DAH!

     I =
need to go the wizard and get a brain!

     F-S


    On Tue, Apr 21, 2009=
 at 7:36 AM, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:
=





      There are some that do have this capability. I believe mine does=
, though I have not used that function. I have the Olympus WM-300. It is a =
little more expensive brand new, I believe like $160 or something, but I bo=
ught mine refurbished for $60.

      Anyway, I will try it to make sure, b=
ut I am pretty sure you can rewind and relisten, not having to go back to t=
he beginning.

      April

        ----- Original Message ----- 
        F=
rom: Frank Sumption 
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
        Sent: Mon=
day, April 20, 2009 8:51 PM
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR


=

        The only thing I don't like is that the digital recorders don't ha=
ve que and review funtions that tape decks have, you can't back up and re-l=
isten to a voice, you have to go back to the beginning, unless the file is =
copied the computer. 

         BTW, I don't do ghost hunts. 

         Fra=
nk-S


        On Mon, Apr 20, 2009 at 8:01 PM, April Abercrombie <april@ab=
ercrombieghostresearch.com> wrote:





          Oh LOL!! No...you are tec=
hnically correct.

          There are 2 instruments that us ghost hunters =
have in our arsenal that can go by the name of "DVR"; Digital Voice Recorde=
r and Digital Video Recorder.

          To save some confusion, some of us=
 refer to a digital voice recorder as simply a voice recorder. I have gotte=
n so used to this term that I automatically think digital video recorder wh=
en I hear DVR.

          I also have an Olympus digital voice recorder. I =
LOVE it. In fact, I have had many over the years. I have had other brands t=
oo, but Olympus recorders are the best, as far as the affordable versions g=
o.

          April

            ----- Original Message ----- 
            =
From: purplespacefriend 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
         =
   Sent: Monday, April 20, 2009 7:40 PM
            Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: =
A new DVR


            DVR, as in digital voice recorder. I'm not usded to=
 using this new techno stuff, so maybe the terminology is wrong. Anyway, I =
got it at Sams, $60, and it does have an external mic jack. I made a line t=
o mic level adapter so I can record directly from the boxes. This one has b=
uilt in USB connector, so it connects directly the PC. It records in WMA fo=
rmat, and that is easliy converted to mp3, or played my windows media playe=
r. 

            F-S

            --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Ab=
ercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
            >
            > You have to tell =
how much and were to get one. I need a new DVR for my night vision cameras.=
 I need to be able to hook an external mic to it as well, as the cameras do=
 not have audio capability. I was going to buy the Radio Shack one as someo=
ne suggested to me. Which would be fine, but I would really like to have US=
B connection.
            > 
            > Does it have an internal harddri=
ve?
            > 
            > April 


            > 
            > ----=
- Original Message ----- 
            > From: Frank Sumption 
            >=
 To: grassharp@yahoogroups.com ; evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
            > Sen=
t: Sunday, April 19, 2009 9:43 PM
            > Subject: [EVP-ITC] A new DV=
R [7 Attachments]
            > 
            > 
            > [Attachment(s=
) from Frank Sumption included below] 
            > 
            > 
      =
      > 
            > I bought a Radio Shack digital recored years, and ne=
ver liked it much. I picked up an Olympus WS-21S this afternoon on a whim. =
I made a line to mic adapter, and did a couple box recordings. I don't know=
, might be better than tape. I has the advantage of of built in USB connect=
or, and it records in WMA format. 
            > 
            > I tried a s=
hort recording last night using the tones in 51, I don't think they help. 
=
            > 
            > Frank-S
            >
